abstract.text: This class provides a standard way to handle actions
that are triggered by the keyboard.

inlineContent.text: KeyboardKit automatically creates an instance of the
class when the keyboard is launched, then injects it
by default, but it can override any
of the standard behaviors. It has
something should be done, and if so,
You can inherit this class to get base functionality,
then override any open parts that you want to change.
This service can also be resolved with the shorthand

abstract.text: KeyboardKit helps you create fully customizable keyboard extensions, using Swift and SwiftUI.
Whether to register an emoji after a certain action gesture.
The audio feedback to use for an action gesture.
Whether to remove an autocomplete inserted space after a certain gesture action.

The controller to which this handler applies.

explicit controller.
This class provides a standard way to handle actions
that are triggered by the keyboard.
Try to trigger audio and haptic feedback for the
provided gesture action.
The start point of the last space drag, if any.
Try to trigger haptic feedback for the action.
This protocol can be implemented by any classes that can
define keyboard-specific behaviors.
Handle a certain action gesture, with replace logic.
Try to end the current sentence after a certain action gesture.

This function is inlined by KeyboardKit Pro, to make
it possible perform Pro-based action replacements.
The haptic feedback to use for an action gesture.

This enum defines keyboard-specific actions, and is also
a namespace for keyboard action-related types.
